node.title: Russia warns U.S. against further arming Ukraine
node.description: The diplomatic note used the same type of language Moscow has been offering for some time.

node.title: Dollar Tree recalls more than 1 million hot glue guns
node.description: The discount retailer has received reports of electrical malfunctions and fires while the device is plugged in.

node.title: White House Easter Egg Roll returns
node.description: The White House expects 30,000 people to fill the White House's South Lawn.

node.title: Why an NFT auction of the first tweet flopped so terribly
node.description: Sina Estavi was hoping to sell his nonfungible token for $48 million, but managed a high bid of just $12,600.

node.title: China stages military exercises as U.S. lawmakers visit Taiwan
node.description: The military drills conducted in areas opposite Taiwan were "a countermeasure to the recent negative actions of the U.S.," a Beijing spokesperson said.

node.title: Man summits Mount Kilimanjaro after donating kidney to stranger
node.description: Steve Wilson said he still doesn't know the person who received his kidney and he probably never will — and he's fine with that. He just wanted it to change somebody's life, he said.

node.title: Russia may already be in default, Moody's says
node.description: Russia made some bond payments in rubles rather than dollars after tightening sanctions cut it off further from the Western financial system.

node.title: New York Islanders legend Mike Bossy dead at 65
node.description: Daughter Tanya Bossy said her father was "no longer in pain."

node.title: Stranded dolphin dies after beachgoers try to "ride" it, rescuers say
node.description: "This type of harassment causes undue stress to wild dolphins, is dangerous for the people who interact with them and is illegal," rescuers said.

node.title: Mysterious die-off of sea urchins in Caribbean: "It's happening so quickly"
node.description: Dive shops first began reporting the deaths in February, perplexing scientists and worrying government officials in the islands.

node.title: Russia warns of further attacks on Kyiv after sinking of flagship warship
node.description: A renewed bombardment of Ukraine's capital city could return residents to sheltering in subway stations.

node.title: Person shot and wounded outside home of rapper DaBaby
node.description: The shooting is the latest in a series of incidents involving DaBaby, whose real name is Jonathan Kirk.

node.title: Biden administration protects Cameroonians in the U.S. from deportation
node.description: The Department of Homeland Security said Cameroon cannot safely accept the return of its citizens because of the country's ongoing civil war.

node.title: John Travolta posts tribute to late son
node.description: Jett Travolta died in 2009 at age 16 while the family was on vacation in the Bahamas.

node.title: Biden taps Michael Barr for Fed's bank regulation position
node.description: The president's first choice, Sarah Bloom Raskin, withdrew her nomination due to insufficient support in the Senate.

node.title: "Old Enough!" sparks debate about whether its toddler participants are
node.description: Hit Japanese series now offered by Netflix features toddlers as young as two running errands and completing tasks on their own in cities.

node.title: Harry and Meghan visit Queen during U.K. stopover
node.description: Harry was last reported to have been in the U.K. in July 2021 and Meghan isn't believed to have been there since 2020.

node.title: Police ID body found in 1992 as teen, now "focus on finding her killer "
node.description: "She was not trash. She was a beautiful, loving, funny, upbeat person who didn't deserve this," Maggie Sniegowski's brother said.

node.title: Russia says Moskva warship has sunk, after Ukraine said it hit the flagship with missile strike
node.description: The Ukrainian military said its forces had badly damaged the ship​ with a missile strike off Ukraine's battered southern coast.

node.title: First interstellar meteor to hit Earth confirmed
node.description: Harvard researchers are 99.999% certain the object was interstellar. But their paper on the finding was being turned down, because the pair only had a private conversation with an anonymous U.S. government employee to confirm the accuracy of the data.

node.title: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis signs 15-week abortion ban bill into law
node.description: The measure is one of several abortion recent restrictions signed by Republican governors.

node.title: British ISIS member convicted on all counts for deadly kidnapping plot
node.description: El Shafee Elsheikh was found guilty of participating in a brutal ISIS hostage-taking scheme that led to the deaths of four Americans.

node.title: Kentucky man indicted in killing of former lawmaker's daughter
node.description: Investigators said Gilday told them he was determined to get access to a bunker in the multi-million dollar home and was willing to kill everyone inside.

node.title: Girl, 9, allegedly shot by merchant says she'll "never forgive" him
node.description: She was mistakenly hit by bullets as she waited to have her picture taken with a mall Easter bunny.

node.title: One dead after car crash near Queenstown
node.description: One person has died and another has been critically injured in a crash near Queenstown.

node.title: Man who referenced "apocalypse" convicted of killing wife, 3 kids, dog
node.description: After his arrest, Todt said his the family needed to "pass over to the other side together because the apocalypse was coming," prosecutors say.

node.title: Sir Mark Todd's suspension 'a bit of a joke' - SAFE
node.description: An animal rights organisation says Sir Mark Todd's hitting a horse with a tree branch nine times amounts to cruelty, and a four-month ban is a slap on the wrist.

node.title: Polish Ambassador to U.S. says Zelenskyy is "leader of the free world"
node.description: On "The Takeout" podcast this week, Ambassador Marek Magierowski weighs in on Russia's war in Ukraine.

node.title: Clashes at Jerusalem holy site leave scores of Palestinians injured
node.description: Tensions were already heightened amid a recent wave of violence. The clashes came as Ramadan this year coincides with Passover and Christian holy week.

node.title: Sir Mark Todd banned for four months
node.description: Sir Mark Todd has been suspended from training racehorses for four months after a video showed him hitting a horse with a tree branch.
